29enum
30{
31 Id_Var, //1

33 Id_StringVar,
34 Id_Command,
35 Id_Alias, //5
36 Id_Local,
37 Id_Do,
38 Id_DoArgs,

46enum
47{
48 Idf_Persist = 1<<0,
49 Idf_Override = 1<<1,
50 Idf_Hex = 1<<2,
51 Idf_ReadOnly = 1<<3,
52 Idf_Overridden = 1<<4,
53 Idf_Unknown = 1<<5,
54 Idf_Arg = 1<<6,
55};

57struct ident;
58
59struct identval
60{
61 union
62 {
63 int i; // Id_Var, ValueInteger
64 float f; // Id_FloatVar, ValueFloat
65 char *s; // Id_StringVar, ValueString
66 const uint *code; // ValueCode
67 ident *id; // ValueIdent
68 const char *cstr; // ValueCString
69 };
70};
71
72struct tagval : identval
73{
74 int type;
75
76 void setint(int val);
77 void setfloat(float val);
78 void setnumber(double val);
79 void setstr(char *val);
80 void setnull();
81 void setcode(const uint *val);
82 void setmacro(const uint *val);
83 void setcstr(const char *val);
84 void setident(ident *val);
85
86 const char *getstr() const;
87 int getint() const;
88 float getfloat() const;
89 double getnumber() const;
90 bool getbool() const;
91 void getval(tagval &r) const;
92
93 void cleanup();
94};
95
96struct identstack
97{
98 identval val;
99 int valtype;
100 identstack *next;
101};

103typedef void (__cdecl *identfun)(ident *id);
104
113struct ident
114{
115 //this pointer will point to different types depending upon the type of variable
116 union identvalptr
117 {
118 void *p;
119 int *i;
120 float *f;
121 char **s;
122 };
123
124 uchar type;
125 union
126 {
127 uchar valtype;
128 uchar numargs;
129 };
130 ushort flags;
131 int index;
132 const char *name;
133 union
134 {
135 struct // Id_Var, Id_FloatVar, Id_StringVar
136 {
137 union //number var range union type
138 {
139 struct
140 {
141 int minval,
142 maxval;
143 }; // Id_Var
144 struct
145 {
146 float minvalf,
147 maxvalf;
148 }; // Id_FloatVar
149 };
150 identvalptr storage;
151 identval overrideval;
152 };
153 struct // Id_Alias
154 {
155 uint *code;
156 identval val;
157 identstack *stack;
158 };
159 struct // Id_Command
160 {
161 const char *args;
162 uint argmask;
163 };
164 };
165 identfun fun;
167 ident() {}
171 ident(int t, const char *n, int m, int x, int *s, void *f = nullptr, int flags = 0)
172 : type(t), flags(flags | (m > x ? Idf_ReadOnly : 0)), name(n), minval(m), maxval(x), fun((identfun)f)
173 { storage.i = s; }
174
178 ident(int t, const char *n, float m, float x, float *s, void *f = nullptr, int flags = 0)
179 : type(t), flags(flags | (m > x ? Idf_ReadOnly : 0)), name(n), minvalf(m), maxvalf(x), fun((identfun)f)
180 { storage.f = s; }
181
185 ident(int t, const char *n, char **s, void *f = nullptr, int flags = 0)
186 : type(t), flags(flags), name(n), fun((identfun)f)
187 { storage.s = s; }
188
189 // Id_Alias
190 ident(int t, const char *n, char *a, int flags)
191 : type(t), valtype(Value_String), flags(flags), name(n), code(nullptr), stack(nullptr)
192 { val.s = a; }
193
194 ident(int t, const char *n, int a, int flags)
195 : type(t), valtype(Value_Integer), flags(flags), name(n), code(nullptr), stack(nullptr)
196 { val.i = a; }
197
198 ident(int t, const char *n, float a, int flags)
199 : type(t), valtype(Value_Float), flags(flags), name(n), code(nullptr), stack(nullptr)
200 { val.f = a; }
201
202 ident(int t, const char *n, int flags)
203 : type(t), valtype(Value_Null), flags(flags), name(n), code(nullptr), stack(nullptr)
204 {}
205 ident(int t, const char *n, const tagval &v, int flags)
206 : type(t), valtype(v.type), flags(flags), name(n), code(nullptr), stack(nullptr)
207 { val = v; }
208
212 ident(int t, const char *n, const char *args, uint argmask, int numargs, void *f = nullptr, int flags = 0)
213 : type(t), numargs(numargs), flags(flags), name(n), args(args), argmask(argmask), fun((identfun)f)
214 {}
215
216 void changed()
217 {
218 if(fun)
219 {
220 fun(this);
221 }
222 }
223
224 void setval(const tagval &v)
225 {
226 valtype = v.type;
227 val = v;
228 }
229
230 void setval(const identstack &v)
231 {
232 valtype = v.valtype;
233 val = v.val;
234 }
235
236 void forcenull()
237 {
238 if(valtype==Value_String)
239 {
240 delete[] val.s;
241 }
242 valtype = Value_Null;
243 }
244
245 float getfloat() const;
246 int getint() const;
247 double getnumber() const;
248 const char *getstr() const;
249 void getval(tagval &r) const;
250 void getcstr(tagval &v) const;
251 void getcval(tagval &v) const;
252};

306inline int parseint(const char *s)
307{
308 return static_cast<int>(strtoul(s, nullptr, 0));

515
516// nasty macros for registering script functions, abuses globals to avoid excessive infrastructure
517
518//* note: many of the VARF comments are very repetitive, because the code itself is nearly duplicated too *//
519
520/* how command registration works:
521 * In C++, all global variables must be initiated before main() is called
522 * Each of these macro kludges (which are placed at the global scope level) initializes some kind of global variable
523 * Because the macro kludges are the definition of global variables, at program initializiation, they must be run first
524 * The values of the variables themselves don't matter because they only exist to cheat and run before main()
525 * The macro kludges themselves register commands or values within some vector<>-s which keeps track of all cmds/vars
526 */
527
528/*
529 * Parameter Flags (exhaustive list, not exhaustive descriptions)
530 * i an integer parameter
531 * b a boolean parameter
532 * f a float parameter (sets to 0 if over parameter limit)
533 * F a float parameter (sets to value of previous parameter if over parameter limit)
534 * s a string parameter (sets to new allocated string "" if over parameter limit)
535 * S a string paremter (sets current string to "" if over parameter limit)
536 * t sets to null if over parameter limit
537 * T same as "t"
538 * e a code block parameter
539 * E a code block paremter (null)
540 * r an ident parameter
541 * $ an ident parameter
542 * N a number parameter
543 * D a bind parameter (e.g. player movement)
544 * C an ident parameter, ComC
545 * V an ident parameter, ComV
546 * 1 repeat one arg
547 * 2 repeat two args
548 * 3 repeat three args
549 * 4 repeat four args
550 */
551
552//integer var macros
553//VAR_, _VARF, VARM_ are templates for "normal" macros that do not execute an inline function
554#define VAR_(name, global, min, cur, max, persist) int global = variable(#name, min, cur, max, &global, nullptr, persist)
555#define VARN(name, global, min, cur, max) VAR_(name, global, min, cur, max, 0)
556#define VARNP(name, global, min, cur, max) VAR_(name, global, min, cur, max, Idf_Persist)
557#define VARNR(name, global, min, cur, max) VAR_(name, global, min, cur, max, Idf_Override)
558#define VAR(name, min, cur, max) VAR_(name, name, min, cur, max, 0)
559#define VARP(name, min, cur, max) VAR_(name, name, min, cur, max, Idf_Persist)
560#define VARR(name, min, cur, max) VAR_(name, name, min, cur, max, Idf_Override)
561
562//variable with inline function to be executed on change (VARiable with Function = VARF)
563#define VARF_(name, global, min, cur, max, body, persist) \
564 int global = variable(#name, min, cur, max, &global, [] (ident *) { body; }, persist); /* assign variable, needs fxn prototype declared above */
565
566#define VARFN(name, global, min, cur, max, body) VARF_(name, global, min, cur, max, body, 0)
567#define VARF(name, min, cur, max, body) VARF_(name, name, min, cur, max, body, 0)
568#define VARFP(name, min, cur, max, body) VARF_(name, name, min, cur, max, body, Idf_Persist)
569#define VARFR(name, min, cur, max, body) VARF_(name, name, min, cur, max, body, Idf_Override)
570#define VARFNP(name, global, min, cur, max, body) VARF_(name, global, min, cur, max, body, Idf_Persist)
571
572//hexadecimal var macros
573#define HVAR_(name, global, min, cur, max, persist) int global = variable(#name, min, cur, max, &global, nullptr, persist | Idf_Hex)
574#define HVARP(name, min, cur, max) HVAR_(name, name, min, cur, max, Idf_Persist)
575
576//hex variable with function to be executed on change (Hexadecimal VARiable with Function = HVARF)
577//the CVAR series of macros borrows the HVARF macro as it deals with hex colors
578#define HVARF_(name, global, min, cur, max, body, persist) \
579 int global = variable(#name, min, cur, max, &global, [] (ident *) { body; }, persist | Idf_Hex); /* assign variable, needs fxn prototype declared above */
580
581//color var macros
582#define CVAR_(name, cur, init, body, persist) bvec name = bvec::hexcolor(cur); HVARF_(name, _##name, 0, cur, 0xFFFFFF, { init; name = bvec::hexcolor(_##name); body; }, persist)
583#define CVARP(name, cur) CVAR_(name, cur, , , Idf_Persist)
584#define CVARR(name, cur) CVAR_(name, cur, , , Idf_Override)
585#define CVARFP(name, cur, body) CVAR_(name, cur, , body, Idf_Persist)
586#define CVAR0_(name, cur, body, persist) CVAR_(name, cur, { if(!_##name) _##name = cur; }, body, persist)
587#define CVAR0R(name, cur) CVAR0_(name, cur, , Idf_Override)
588#define CVAR1_(name, cur, body, persist) CVAR_(name, cur, { if(_##name <= 255) _##name |= (_##name<<8) | (_##name<<16); }, body, persist)
589#define CVAR1R(name, cur) CVAR1_(name, cur, , Idf_Override)
590#define CVAR1FR(name, cur, body) CVAR1_(name, cur, body, Idf_Override)
591
592//float var macros
593#define FVAR_(name, global, min, cur, max, persist) float global = fvariable(#name, min, cur, max, &global, nullptr, persist)
594#define FVARNP(name, global, min, cur, max) FVAR_(name, global, min, cur, max, Idf_Persist)
595#define FVAR(name, min, cur, max) FVAR_(name, name, min, cur, max, 0)
596#define FVARP(name, min, cur, max) FVAR_(name, name, min, cur, max, Idf_Persist)
597#define FVARR(name, min, cur, max) FVAR_(name, name, min, cur, max, Idf_Override)
598
599//float variable with function to be executed on change (Float VARiable with Function = FVARF)
600#define FVARF_(name, global, min, cur, max, body, persist) \
601 float global = fvariable(#name, min, cur, max, &global, [] (ident *) { body; }, persist); /* assign variable, needs fxn prototype declared above */ \
602
603#define FVARF(name, min, cur, max, body) FVARF_(name, name, min, cur, max, body, 0)
604#define FVARFP(name, min, cur, max, body) FVARF_(name, name, min, cur, max, body, Idf_Persist)
605#define FVARFR(name, min, cur, max, body) FVARF_(name, name, min, cur, max, body, Idf_Override)
606
607//string var macros
608#define SVAR_(name, global, cur, persist) char *global = svariable(#name, cur, &global, nullptr, persist)
609#define SVAR(name, cur) SVAR_(name, name, cur, 0)
610#define SVARP(name, cur) SVAR_(name, name, cur, Idf_Persist)
611#define SVARR(name, cur) SVAR_(name, name, cur, Idf_Override)
612
613//string variable with function to be executed on change (Float VARiable with Function = FVARF)
614#define SVARF_(name, global, cur, body, persist) \
615 char *global = svariable(#name, cur, &global, [] (ident *) { body; }, persist); /* assign variable, needs fxn prototype declared above */
616
617#define SVARF(name, cur, body) SVARF_(name, name, cur, body, 0)
618#define SVARFR(name, cur, body) SVARF_(name, name, cur, body, Idf_Override)
619
620#endif /* COMMAND_H_ */
